Name: Spelletjescaf√© 2 Klaveren
Review Text: Great place if you are looking for a night playing board games with your friends. Advisable to book in advance since the place does get a bit busy. The games collection itself is huge. Loved their house wine. The staff could be a bit more friendly though.

Name: Spelletjescaf√© 2 Klaveren
Review Text: Decent beer and coffee, good atmosphere and friendly staff. Plenty of games in stock, but it's ok to bring your own. Kitchen available, don't expect a full restaurant-like menu but it is more than decent for a venue this size.

Name: Spelletjescaf√© 2 Klaveren
Review Text: This is a wonderful place. Full of board games and ocasionally hosting small events for board games, this place brings many expats and fans of any type of games together. A lot of backgammon players there too. Prices might be slightly high, but grabbing a cappuccino and playing for longer time is not a problem.

Name: Spelletjescaf√© 2 Klaveren
Review Text: Ground floor is a Cafe / bar, and there are various board games to play. The basement is an open area where you can sit, have food and drink, and play games. While I was there, a Magic:the Gathering tournament was going on.

Name: Spelletjescaf√© 2 Klaveren
Review Text: Friendly staff and customers. Has an older crowd socialising and playing cards or other games. Light and sunny. Great place to do my Dutch homework.

Name: Spelletjescaf√© 2 Klaveren
Review Text: The food is very down to earth, the service is uneven, but their board games and their hosting nerdy events earns this place a very special place in the area, and indeed in Amsterdam. Roleplay evenings, Magic launch parties, or Hearthstone tournaments happen there, and nowhere else!
